channel.title: CVE Feed for Eaton -- Intelligent Power manager (IPM)
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Eaton -- Intelligent Power manager (IPM)

item.title: CVE-2021-23277|2024-09-16T18:38:30.132Z -- eaton -- intelligent%20power%20manager%20%28ipm%29
item.description: Eaton Intelligent Power Manager (IPM) prior to 1.69 is vulnerable to unauthenticated eval injection vulnerability. The software does not neutralize code syntax from users before using in the dynamic evaluation call in loadUserFile function under scripts/libs/utils.js. Successful exploitation can allow attackers to control the input to the function and execute attacker controlled commands.

item.title: CVE-2021-23280|2024-09-16T17:24:07.762Z -- eaton -- intelligent%20power%20manager%20%28ipm%29
item.description: Eaton Intelligent Power Manager (IPM) prior to 1.69 is vulnerable to authenticated arbitrary file upload vulnerability. IPMâ€™s maps_srv.js allows an attacker to upload a malicious NodeJS file using uploadBackgroud action. An attacker can upload a malicious code or execute any command using a specially crafted packet to exploit the vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2021-23279|2024-09-16T17:18:54.414Z -- eaton -- intelligent%20power%20manager%20%28ipm%29
item.description: Eaton Intelligent Power Manager (IPM) prior to 1.69 is vulnerable to unauthenticated arbitrary file delete vulnerability induced due to improper input validation in meta_driver_srv.js class with saveDriverData action using invalidated driverID. An attacker can send specially crafted packets to delete the files on the system where IPM software is installed.
